article_title: Where the candidates stand on immigration reform
article_text:
Paul has proposed a “Trust but Verify” amendment that would require Congress to enforce its own border security blueprint, including security safeguards to track student visas holders and refugees, and incarceration for any visa overstays or illegal entrants. (RandPaul.com, TheWeek.com)

“We have to have a pause on immigration from the Middle East till we can get a handle on are we admitting people who want to attack and kill us? We have 150,000 students here from the Middle East. Do we know where they all are? Do we know they are in school? Do we know that they haven’t overstayed their visas?” (CNN, Dec. 7, 2015)

article_metadata.description:
Each candidate’s position on how we should manage and pay for college, gleaned from their public statements on the issue. 



Patrick Semansky/Associated Press





Hillary Clinton 

Former US secretary of state 
Clinton calls for a path to “full and equal citizenship” for those in the country illegally (HillaryClinton.

og.title: Where the candidates stand on immigration reform - The Boston Globe

article_summary:
(RandPaul.com, TheWeek.com)“We have to have a pause on immigration from the Middle East till we can get a handle on are we admitting people who want to attack and kill us?
We have 150,000 students here from the Middle East.
Do we know that they haven’t overstayed their visas?” (CNN, Dec. 7, 2015)
Paul has proposed a “Trust but Verify” amendment that would require Congress to enforce its own border security blueprint, including security safeguards to track student visas holders and refugees, and incarceration for any visa overstays or illegal entrants.
Do we know where they all are?
